msContents.summary: Letter pertaining to work on embankments.

msItem.note: Text is on one side only, 8 lines written with the fibers, in three hands. All margins are intact. Lines 1-4 are in one hand, ending at "autou i" in line 4. Lines 4-7 are in a second hand, from "Epeiph" in 4 through all of 7. Line 8 is in a third hand. Text mentions the location of Theadelphia.

supportDesc.support: 6.8 x 7.1cm. Mostly intact; the top-left corner has a piece missing and there are several small holes along the left margin. There appear to be one (maybe two) vertical crease marks.

origin.persName: Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

div.ab: The 10th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius. Work has been done for the embankment works of the same tenth year from the 16th to the 20th Epeiph at the Psinali...dyke at Theadelphia by Horus, son of Panesneus, son of Nepheros, his mother being Soeris. Signed by me, Marinus. (Grenfell, Hunt, & Hogarth)
